availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George P. Jones (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth I. Marsh Jones. Father of Charles T. Jones, Mary F. Jones, Clementine Jones, and Caroline W. Jones. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Samuel, in Montgomery County in 1857. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 10A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 35.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 264.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 77B
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Menard County, Township 17, District 7, p. 74A.
Illinois Death Certificates, 1916-1950, Illinois Department of Public Health, Division of Vital Records, Springfield, IL. Morgan County, No. 374.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Montgomery County Births.
"George P Jones (1816-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 210456479, accessed October 16, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/210456479.
